availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Proctor
Owsley County
Kentucky
To his Excelance,

The Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky. This day personally appeared Mrs A C Hunter the wife of John W Hunter of Owsley County and made oath before me A. B. McGuire Clerk of the Owsly Circuit Court. Whereas there was an Indictment in sd Court at its October term 1863 and judgment by default in may 1864 for the sum of sixty dollars for keeping of a tipling house by selling of whiskey by a negro man Jim -- without the Consent of, nor Knowledge of either of us. My husband was absent at the time of Court, and still remains absent -- Wherefore I pray relief, of that portion going to the Commonwealth, I Mrs A C Hunter says that the statements in the foregoing affidavit to be true as she verily believes.
Sworn to before me by Mrs A C Hunter this 18th day July 1864
A B McGuire C O C C

In pursuance to the above affidavit To his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky ^we^ petition the remittance of that portion of said fine going to the Commonwealth
against John W Hunter. From the affidavit herein. We the petitioners believe the fine ought to be remitted
